root_causes: No validation for the converse OE consistency: OE text present but OE code (A4x2_5) not selected is not checked.
OE length validation (minimum 5 characters per expected CheckOpenLengthMultiOE) is missing â€” script only checks for non-empty text.
Expected CheckMultiOpenD1() logic (open-ended multi-item consistency) is not implemented.
instructions: Add a check for OE text present but OE code not selected. Example SPSS condition to flag violations: TEMPORARY. SELECT IF (NOT MISSING(A4x2_5_other) AND LENGTH(RTRIM(A4x2_5_other)) > 0 AND A4x2_5 <> 1).
Enforce the OE minimum length requirement (5 chars). Example SPSS condition: TEMPORARY. SELECT IF (A4x2_5 = 1 AND LENGTH(RTRIM(A4x2_5_other)) < 5).

Implement the CheckMultiOpenD1() logic (ensure multi-open-item consistency). If CheckMultiOpenD1() enforces that only designated open-ended items may have text or checks for multiple open-text entries, replicate that logic. For this question (single OE item), ensure you at least verify there are no unexpected open-text entries in other multi-items (e.g., SELECT IF ( (NOT MISSING(A4x2_1_other) AND A4x2_1 <> 1) OR ... ) ).

Keep the existing DK mutual-exclusivity and minimum-selection checks, but ensure the OE-related checks run in the same validation block so all OE/code consistency and length rules are enforced together.
